name: Acidic Sliver
oracle_text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: This permanent deals 2 damage to any target."
flavor_text: The first sliver burst against the cave wall, and others piled in behind to deepen the new tunnel.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

name: Amok
oracle_text: {1}, Discard a card at random: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
flavor_text: Crovax's rage was horrifying. Within moments only blood and shreds of flesh remained of the shapeshifter.

name: Awakening
oracle_text: At the beginning of each upkeep, untap all creatures and lands.
flavor_text:
"There are times when destiny calls forth a people and demands an action. Now is the time. We are the people. This is our action. Charge!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

rulings.text: In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

name: Bandage
oracle_text: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: Takara shook with guilt. She knew the last image her father had seen was her sword flashing toward him.

rulings.text: You draw the card when Bandage resolves, not when the damage is actually prevented.

name: Bottomless Pit
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player discards a card at random.
flavor_text:
"I'm sure it came with the place. I don't think you build one on purpose."
—Gerrard

rulings.text: The ability is controlled by the player who controls Bottomless Pit. This means that Bottomless Pit can trigger abilities which trigger off an opponent forcing you to discard.

name: Brush with Death
oracle_text: Buyback {2}{B}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{B}{B} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target opponent loses 2 life. You gain 2 life.

name: Bullwhip
oracle_text: {2}, {T}: Bullwhip deals 1 damage to target creature. That creature attacks this turn if able.
flavor_text:
"Pain is a crude way to enforce obedience, but it is cheap and plentiful."
—Volrath

rulings.text: If the creature can attack, it must. If it cannot, then nothing happens.

name: Burgeoning
oracle_text: Whenever an opponent plays a land, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
flavor_text:
"The plants said, ‘We will fight the stone with root and stem and seed. We are patient. We will win.'"
—Skyshroud myth of the forest

rulings.text: Playing a land will trigger it, but putting a land onto the battlefield as part of an effect will not.

name: Calming Licid
oracle_text: {W}, {T}: Calming Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {W} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature can't attack.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can’t be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid’s controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

name: Cannibalize
oracle_text: Choose two target creatures controlled by the same player. Exile one of those creatures and put two +1/+1 counters on the other.
flavor_text: "Mine."

rulings.text: You choose the two target creatures during announcement. You choose which gets the counters and which is to get exiled on resolution.

name: Carnassid
oracle_text: Trample
{1}{G}: Regenerate Carnassid.
flavor_text: The hunter would never forget the time or place where he first met the carnassid, for they buried him there.

name: Change of Heart
oracle_text: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target creature can't attack this turn.

rulings.text: Change of Heart will not remove an already attacking creature from combat. It must be cast before attackers are declared or it won’t have any noticeable effect on the game.

name: Cloud Spirit
oracle_text: Flying
Cloud Spirit can block only creatures with flying.
flavor_text:
Clouds are the soil, dreams are the crop.
—Kor saying

rulings.text: If it loses Flying, it will be unable to block any creatures.

name: Constant Mists
oracle_text: Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

name: Contemplation
oracle_text: Whenever you cast a spell, you gain 1 life.
flavor_text:
"How fascinating it is to watch the machinations of one's own mind play themselves out."
—Volrath

name: Contempt
oracle_text: Enchant creature
When enchanted creature attacks, return it and Contempt to their owners' hands at end of combat.
flavor_text:
"Predictable little man. In all these years you taught me so much yet learned so little."
—Volrath, to Starke

name: Conviction
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return Conviction to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: It was not the minotaur's shoulders but his soul that bore the heaviest weight.

rulings.text: Players don’t have priority to cast spells and activate abilities between combat damage being assigned and being dealt. This means that if you want to return Conviction to its owner’s hand before combat damage is dealt, you must do so before combat damage is assigned (and the creature will no longer get +1/+3).

Because damage remains marked on a creature until it’s removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to the enchanted creature may become lethal if you return Conviction to its owner’s hand during that turn.

name: Convulsing Licid
oracle_text: {R}, {T}: Convulsing Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {R} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature can't block.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can’t be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid’s controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

name: Corrupting Licid
oracle_text: {B}, {T}: Corrupting Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {B} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can’t be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid’s controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

name: Craven Giant
oracle_text: Craven Giant can't block.
flavor_text:
What is high as a mountain and low as a snake?
—Dal riddle

name: Crossbow Ambush
oracle_text: Creatures you control gain reach until end of turn. (They can block creatures with flying.)
flavor_text:
There is no drake that flies faster than a crossbow bolt.
—Vec saying

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

name: Crovax the Cursed
oracle_text: Crovax the Cursed enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice a creature. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Crovax. If you don't, remove a +1/+1 counter from Crovax.
{B}: Crovax gains flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: Crovax can sacrifice itself to its upkeep triggered ability.
You can only sacrifice one creature to it each turn.
If you choose not to sacrifice a creature and he has no +1/+1 counters, then nothing bad happens. Note that some other effect must be keeping him alive if he has no counters.

name: Crystalline Sliver
oracle_text: All Slivers have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
flavor_text: Bred as living shields, these slivers have proven unruly—they know they cannot be caught.

rulings.text: The ability only applies while this card is on the battlefield.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

name: Dauthi Trapper
oracle_text: {T}: Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor_text: Merfolk tell their young of Dandân, humans of Rag Man. Dal tell tales of the Dauthi, and they are far worse.

name: Death Stroke
oracle_text: Destroy target tapped creature.
flavor_text: For a sharp second, Selenia froze, and Crovax's blade found home. As the angel shattered like glass, Crovax felt his mind collapse—the curse had been fulfilled.

name: Dream Halls
oracle_text: Rather than pay the mana cost for a spell, its controller may discard a card that shares a color with that spell.
flavor_text: Within without.

rulings.text: This only replaces the mana cost (the mana in the upper right hand corner of the card). It will not pay additional costs from the card text (such as Buyback) or from other effects. It does not prevent you from paying those additional costs if you want or need to.

name: Dream Prowler
oracle_text: Dream Prowler can't be blocked as long as it's attacking alone.
flavor_text:
"To think that some find sleep a restful state."
—Volrath

name: Duct Crawler
oracle_text: {1}{R}: Target creature can't block Duct Crawler this turn.
flavor_text:
"The mountain's ducts will be like organ pipes, amplifying the glorious roar of the dying."
—Stronghold architect, journal

name: Dungeon Shade
oracle_text: Flying
{B}: Dungeon Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: A sickness stirs in its eyes, a nightmare born in darkened wails.

name: Elven Rite
oracle_text: Distribute two +1/+1 counters among one or two target creatures.
flavor_text: As the bough stretches, so shall you grow. As the roots spread, so shall you thrive.

name: Endangered Armodon
oracle_text: When you control a creature with toughness 2 or less, sacrifice Endangered Armodon.
flavor_text: These are its last days. Its doom to be remembered only until the hunters hunger again.

name: Ensnaring Bridge
oracle_text: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.
flavor_text:
"I expected a fight, but I didn't expect it from the building itself."
—Gerrard

rulings.text: Ensnaring Bridge’s effect checks the number of cards in your hand only while a player (including you) is declaring attackers. Once a creature has legally attacked, changing its power or the number of cards in your hand won’t remove it from combat.

name: Evacuation
oracle_text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor_text: The first step of every exodus is from the blood and the fire onto the trail.

name: Fanning the Flames
oracle_text: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Fanning the Flames deals X damage to any target.

name: Flame Wave
oracle_text: Flame Wave deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker and each creature that player or that planeswalker's controller controls.
flavor_text:
"I hear the roaring of a wave whose waters are red and whose mists are black."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Fling
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Fling deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target.
flavor_text: It's raining rats and moggs.

rulings.text: The sacrificed creature’s last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its power.

If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking creature during the declare blockers step, it won’t deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that creature is dealt lethal damage, it’ll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

name: Flowstone Blade
oracle_text: Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Remember the fable of the elf who came upon a cave of gold. In trying to free the largest piece, she was crushed by its weight."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Flowstone Hellion
oracle_text: Haste
{0}: Flowstone Hellion gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Volrath leaves no stone untrained.

rulings.text: It will be put into its owner’s graveyard as soon as one of its abilities resolves that puts its toughness at zero (or less than the current amount of damage on it). This is a state-based action, so there is no way to activate its ability any more to increase its power further before it is put into the graveyard.

name: Flowstone Mauler
oracle_text: Trample
{R}: Flowstone Mauler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Once these horrifying creatures were perfected, there was no need for armodons.

name: Flowstone Shambler
oracle_text: {R}: Flowstone Shambler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Flowstone troops are notoriously difficult to keep in formation.

name: Foul Imp
oracle_text: Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
flavor_text: The imp, unaware of its own odor, paused to catch its breath . . . and promptly died.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 2 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

name: Furnace Spirit
oracle_text: Haste
{R}: Furnace Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: If it can survive the Furnace, you don't want it near you.

name: Gliding Licid
oracle_text: {U}, {T}: Gliding Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {U} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature has flying.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can’t be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid’s controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

name: Grave Pact
oracle_text: Whenever a creature you control dies, each other player sacrifices a creature.
flavor_text:
"The bonds of loyalty can tie one to the grave."
—Crovax

rulings.text: Each other player sacrifices a creature for each creature you control that goes to a graveyard.

name: Hammerhead Shark
oracle_text: Hammerhead Shark can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
flavor_text: Cross the eyes of a hammerhead and you'll dot its teeth.

name: Heartstone
oracle_text: Activated abilities of creatures cost {1} less to activate. This effect can't reduce the amount of mana an ability costs to activate to less than one mana.
flavor_text:
"Finding a true heartstone is even harder than finding a true heart."
—Hanna

rulings.text: The cost reduction can be applied to additional costs.
It will not add a {1} to abilities with no generic mana in their activation cost.
It will never reduce any colored mana portion of an activation cost.
Can’t reduce Snow mana costs.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They’re generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

name: Heat of Battle
oracle_text: Whenever a creature blocks, Heat of Battle deals 1 damage to that creature's controller.
flavor_text: "Takara, it's me!" shouted Starke. It was no use-she obeyed Volrath.

name: Hermit Druid
oracle_text: {G}, {T}: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a basic land card. Put that card into your hand and all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.
flavor_text: Seeking the company of plants ensures that your wits will go to seed.

rulings.text: You can put the cards from your library into your graveyard in any order.

name: Hesitation
oracle_text: When a player casts a spell, sacrifice Hesitation and counter that spell.
flavor_text: Gerrard hesitated, looking up at the enemy ship. The future hesitated with him, changed forever by the pause.

rulings.text: Playing a land is not casting a spell, so playing a land will not trigger this card.

name: Hibernation Sliver
oracle_text: All Slivers have "Pay 2 life: Return this permanent to its owner's hand."
flavor_text: Mogglings have been known to play ball with hibernating slivers, completely unaware of their true nature.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

name: Hidden Retreat
oracle_text: Put a card from your hand on top of your library: Prevent all damage that would be dealt by target instant or sorcery spell this turn.
flavor_text: After an hour in the hidey-hole, Squee seriously pondered the advantages of danger over boredom.

rulings.text: This can be used on damage to a creature, player, or planeswalker.
This can be used on instant or sorcery spells on the stack, but not on abilities.

name: Honor Guard
oracle_text: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"It is not a choice I make, to have this guard. It is the choice of my people, and my duty to them."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Horn of Greed
oracle_text: Whenever a player plays a land, that player draws a card.
flavor_text:
"Rath grows, and I am nourished."
—Volrath

rulings.text: Playing a land will trigger it, but putting a land onto the battlefield as part of an effect will not.

name: Hornet Cannon
oracle_text: {3}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying and haste named Hornet. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Intruder Alarm
oracle_text: Creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, untap all creatures.
flavor_text: Mirri was startled by Volrath's apparition—it had no scent.

rulings.text: If multiple creatures enter the battlefield at one time, this ability triggers once for each creature. This doesn’t matter much, but it can in some cases.

name: Invasion Plans
oracle_text: All creatures block each combat if able.
The attacking player chooses how each creature blocks each combat.
flavor_text: Gerrard studied the globe as Mirri kept watch. Suddenly, his eyes widened. "This is Dominaria!"

name: Jinxed Ring
oracle_text: Whenever a nontoken permanent is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, Jinxed Ring deals 1 damage to you.
Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent gains control of Jinxed Ring. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Lab Rats
oracle_text: Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Create a 1/1 black Rat creature token.

name: Lancers en-Kor
oracle_text: Trample
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Lancers en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
flavor_text: Nearly all sets of Kor twins are trained as lancers.

rulings.text: The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player.
It can redirect damage to itself.
It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature’s toughness.
You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt.
When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

name: Leap
oracle_text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: Mirri leapt quickly and silently. The guard died likewise.

name: Lowland Basilisk
oracle_text: Whenever Lowland Basilisk deals damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
flavor_text: Unlike their cousins, Rathi basilisks turn their victims into puddles of flowstone.

rulings.text: If a creature leaves the battlefield before the end of combat, then the Lowland Basilisk effect on it will end.
If it damages a creature outside of combat, its effect will destroy the creature at the end of the next combat.

name: Mana Leak
oracle_text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
flavor_text:
"The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy."
—Volrath

name: Mask of the Mimic
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a card with the same name as target nontoken creature and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You look for a card of the same name, the current type of the card does not matter.
You do not have to find a card if you do not want to.

If a copy card is targeted by this effect, you get to look for another copy of the card it is copying. This is because a copy card actually takes on the name and initial characteristics of what it copies.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

name: Megrim
oracle_text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor_text: "You can run from your pain," explained Gerrard to Crovax, "but take it from experience: you will tire before it does."

name: Mind Games
oracle_text: Buyback {2}{U} (You may pay an additional {2}{U} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

name: Mind Peel
oracle_text: Buyback {2}{B}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{B}{B} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target player discards a card.

name: Mindwarper
oracle_text: Mindwarper enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}{B}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Mindwarper: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Mob Justice
oracle_text: Mob Justice deals damage to target player or planeswalker equal to the number of creatures you control.
flavor_text: A single stone can start an avalanche.

rulings.text: Creatures are counted on resolution.

name: Mogg Bombers
oracle_text: When another creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice Mogg Bombers and it deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor_text: Behind every great mogg bomber is another mogg with a shovel and a basket.

rulings.text: The Mogg Bombers do trigger on any creatures that enter the battlefield at the same time they do.
If multiple creatures enter the battlefield at the same time, the ability triggers once for each of them. You may choose a different target player or planeswalker for each time it triggers.

The damage is dealt whether or not you sacrifice the Mogg Bombers. For instance, if Mogg Bombers is destroyed or sacrificed in between the time when the ability triggers and when it resolves, then the targeted player will still be dealt 3 damage.

name: Mogg Flunkies
oracle_text: Mogg Flunkies can't attack or block alone.
flavor_text: They'll attack whatever's in front of them—as long as you tell them where that is.

rulings.text: If you control more than one Mogg Flunkies, they can attack or block together, even if no other creatures attack or block.

Although Mogg Flunkies can’t attack alone, other attacking creatures don’t have to attack the same player or planeswalker. For example, Mogg Flunkies could attack an opponent and another creature could attack a planeswalker that opponent controls. Similarly, other blocking creatures don’t have to block the same creature that Mogg Flunkies blocks.
Once Mogg Flunkies has attacked or blocked, it will remain in combat even if you no longer control another attacking or blocking creature.
If an effect says that Mogg Flunkies attacks or blocks if able and you control another creature able to attack or block, you must attack or block with Mogg Flunkies and that creature.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Mogg Flunkies can attack or block with a creature controlled by your teammate, even if no other creatures you control are attacking or blocking.

name: Mogg Infestation
oracle_text: Destroy all creatures target player controls. For each creature that died this way, that player creates two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

name: Mogg Maniac
oracle_text: Whenever Mogg Maniac is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
flavor_text: Stand clear if he gets an itch.

rulings.text: If it blocks a trample creature, it only gets dealt damage equal to what is assigned to it. This means it will likely only get to deal 1 damage to the opponent.

name: Morgue Thrull
oracle_text: Sacrifice Morgue Thrull: Put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.
flavor_text: It's so hard to find good help these days.

name: Mortuary
oracle_text: Whenever a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, put that card on top of your library.
flavor_text:
"Think of them not as failures but as works in progress."
—Volrath

rulings.text: This is not an optional ability.

name: Mox Diamond
oracle_text: If Mox Diamond would enter the battlefield, you may discard a land card instead. If you do, put Mox Diamond onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

rulings.text: If you don’t discard a land card, Mox Diamond never enters the battlefield. It won’t trigger abilities that look for something entering the battlefield, and you won’t get the opportunity to tap it for mana.

name: Mulch
oracle_text: Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
flavor_text: Hope is the one crop that can grow in any climate.

name: Nomads en-Kor
oracle_text: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Nomads en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
flavor_text: The Kor forsake roots for the winding of the path; forsake voices for the silence of the mind; forsake all else for the poverty of isolation.

rulings.text: The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player.
It can redirect damage to itself.
It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature’s toughness.
You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt.
When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

name: Overgrowth
oracle_text: Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}{G}.
flavor_text: Life needs no encouragement.

rulings.text: This is a triggered mana ability.

name: Portcullis
oracle_text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, if there are two or more other creatures on the battlefield, exile that creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control when Portcullis leaves the battlefield.

rulings.text: Creatures which are phasing in will not trigger this card’s ability.
If the creature that triggered Portcullis is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, then it fails to do anything.
You check the count of the number of creatures on the battlefield again during resolution. The creature will not be exiled if the count is 2 or less.

The creature does enter the battlefield, so any other abilities that trigger on it entering the battlefield trigger. This follows the normal rules for timing triggered abilities: first, the current player puts their abilities on the stack in any order, then each other player in turn order does the same. Portcullis’ own ability is included in this, so it could result in the creature being exiled after some abilities have resolved, but before others.

The “when Portcullis leaves the battlefield” ability is set up as part of the ability that exiles the creature. It will trigger when Portcullis leaves the battlefield even if Portcullis has somehow lost its abilities at that time.

name: Primal Rage
oracle_text: Creatures you control have trample. (A creature with trample can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
flavor_text: "Charge!" A great cry went out, and countless elves and Vec soldiers charged up the mountain. Their fury and passion hid the fact that they were horribly outnumbered.

name: Provoke
oracle_text: Untap target creature you don't control. That creature blocks this turn if able.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: Mirri did not have time to think, only to react.

rulings.text: You can target an untapped creature.

name: Pursuit of Knowledge
oracle_text: If you would draw a card, you may put a study counter on Pursuit of Knowledge instead.
Remove three study counters from Pursuit of Knowledge, Sacrifice Pursuit of Knowledge: Draw seven cards.

name: Rabid Rats
oracle_text: {T}: Target blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Every sentence in Volrath's prisons ends the same way.

name: Ransack
oracle_text: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. Put any number of them on the bottom of that library in any order and the rest on top of the library in any order.

name: Rebound
oracle_text: Change the target of target spell that targets only a player. The new target must be a player.
flavor_text: Insult, like an arrow, is beyond control once loosed.

rulings.text: You can’t use this on a spell unless the target spell is an Aura or uses the word “target” in its text. If it isn’t an Aura and the word “target” is not there, then the spell does not target a player at all—it just affects a player without targeting them.

name: Reins of Power
oracle_text: Untap all creatures you control and all creatures target opponent controls. You and that opponent each gain control of all creatures the other controls until end of turn. Those creatures gain haste until end of turn.

rulings.text: It is perfectly legal for either or both players to have zero creatures. They give control of all their zero creatures as instructed.
You only untap creatures controlled by you and the targeted opponent, not all creatures.

name: Revenant
oracle_text: Flying
Revenant's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
flavor_text:
"Not again."
—Hans

rulings.text: The ability that defines Revenant’s power and toughness applies in all zones, not just the battlefield. If Revenant is in your graveyard, its ability will count itself.

name: Rolling Stones
oracle_text: Wall creatures can attack as though they didn't have defender.
flavor_text: Walls collapse and kill people all the time. Some are just more aggressive about it.

name: Ruination
oracle_text: Destroy all nonbasic lands.
flavor_text:
"We have built a wall upon sand. The wall will vanish. The sand will remain."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Sacred Ground
oracle_text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes a land to be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield.
flavor_text:
"That which knows itself cannot be shaped to another's will."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Samite Blessing
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, prevent that damage."
flavor_text:
Knit bone, darn flesh,
Stitch skin, weave breath.
—Samite healing ritual

name: Scapegoat
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Return any number of target creatures you control to their owner's hand.
flavor_text: "Enjoy your deception, Vuel," Gerrard said as Volrath's features melted from the dead shapeshifter. "I'll count this one as practice."

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

name: Seething Anger
oracle_text: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

name: Serpent Warrior
oracle_text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
flavor_text: A hiss before dying.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

name: Shaman en-Kor
oracle_text: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Shaman en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
{1}{W}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that damage is dealt to Shaman en-Kor instead.

rulings.text: The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player.
It can redirect damage to itself.
It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature’s toughness.
You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt.
When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

name: Shard Phoenix
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Sacrifice Shard Phoenix: It deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
{R}{R}{R}: Return Shard Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: You can return Shard Phoenix any time during your upkeep; this is not a beginning of upkeep triggered ability.
Shard Phoenix uses Last Known Information. If, for example, it was blue when it was sacrificed, the damage will come from a blue source.

name: Shifting Wall
oracle_text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Shifting Wall enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
flavor_text:
"You'd almost think Volrath doesn't want me here."
—Gerrard

name: Shock
oracle_text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor_text:
Lightning tethers souls to the world.
—Kor saying

name: Sift
oracle_text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
flavor_text:
"Twice I have let the Legacy slip away. Never again."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Silver Wyvern
oracle_text: Flying
{U}: Change the target of target spell or ability that targets only Silver Wyvern. The new target must be a creature.

rulings.text: You must pick a legal target when redirecting the spell or ability.

name: Skeleton Scavengers
oracle_text: Skeleton Scavengers enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
Pay {1} for each +1/+1 counter on Skeleton Scavengers: Regenerate Skeleton Scavengers. When it regenerates this way, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Skyshroud Archer
oracle_text: {T}: Target creature with flying gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: In Rath, arrows are guided not by virtue but by necessity.

name: Skyshroud Falcon
oracle_text: Flying, vigilance
flavor_text:
The falcon slits the sky to let the light drip through.
—Kor saying

rulings.text: No it is not a Falcon creature type. It is a Bird.

name: Skyshroud Troopers
oracle_text: {T}: Add {G}.
flavor_text:
"We were not made for war. Like flowstone, Volrath shaped us to it."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Sliver Queen
oracle_text: {2}: Create a 1/1 colorless Sliver creature token.
flavor_text: Her children are ever part of her.

name: Smite
oracle_text: Destroy target blocked creature.
flavor_text:
"You've got your childhood wish at last. Now you get to die."
—Gerrard, to Volrath

rulings.text: A “blocked creature” is an attacking creature that has been blocked by a creature this combat, or has become blocked as the result of a spell or ability this combat. Unless the attacking creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocked creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures that blocked it are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat by then.

name: Soltari Champion
oracle_text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Soltari Champion attacks, other creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Spike Breeder
oracle_text: Spike Breeder enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Breeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Breeder: Create a 1/1 green Spike creature token.

name: Spike Colony
oracle_text: Spike Colony enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Colony: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

name: Spike Feeder
oracle_text: Spike Feeder enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: You gain 2 life.

name: Spike Soldier
oracle_text: Spike Soldier enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Soldier: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Soldier: Spike Soldier gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

name: Spike Worker
oracle_text: Spike Worker enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Worker: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

name: Spindrift Drake
oracle_text: Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Spindrift Drake unless you pay {U}.
flavor_text: Sea brine for blood, washing foam for laughter.

name: Spined Sliver
oracle_text: Whenever a Sliver becomes blocked, that Sliver gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

rulings.text: If two Spined Slivers are on the battlefield then each blocked sliver gets +2/+2 for each creature blocking it.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

name: Spined Wurm
flavor_text:
"As it moved, the wurm's spines gathered up bits of flowstone, which took the shapes of dead villagers' heads. Each head spoke a single sound, but if taken together, they said, ‘Alas for the living.'"
—Dal myth of the wurm

name: Spirit en-Kor
oracle_text: Flying
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Spirit en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
flavor_text:
Death free throat from thirst, mouth from speech, feet from earth.
—Kor requiem

rulings.text: The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player.
It can redirect damage to itself.
It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature’s toughness.
You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt.
When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

name: Spitting Hydra
oracle_text: Spitting Hydra enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spitting Hydra: It deals 1 damage to target creature.

name: Stronghold Assassin
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor_text: The assassin sees only throats and hears only heartbeats.

name: Stronghold Taskmaster
oracle_text: Other black creatures get -1/-1.
flavor_text:
"With the completion of each joyous task, we are closer to Yawgmoth's divine vision."
—Stronghold architect, journal

name: Sword of the Chosen
oracle_text: {T}: Target legendary creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text: One shard of Selenia yet remained.

name: Temper
oracle_text: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. For each 1 damage prevented this way, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
flavor_text:
"I don't need a plan, just a goal. The rest will follow on its own."
—Gerrard

rulings.text: You can make X be larger than the amount of damage, but you only get one counter for each actual point of damage prevented.
The +1/+1 counters do show up at the same time as any unprevented damage, which means they are there before you check for lethal damage.

name: Tempting Licid
oracle_text: {G}, {T}: Tempting Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {G} to end this effect.
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can’t be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid’s controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

name: Thalakos Deceiver
oracle_text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Thalakos Deceiver attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, gain control of target creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something “attacks and isn’t blocked” triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

name: Tidal Surge
oracle_text: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.
flavor_text:
"It is nature that gives us our boundaries and nature that enforces them."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Tidal Warrior
oracle_text: {T}: Target land becomes an Island until end of turn.
flavor_text: The tide of battle favors those who can swim.

name: Torment
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -3/-0.
flavor_text:
"Volrath has killed me. All that remains of me is the scar!"
—Tahngarth

name: Tortured Existence
oracle_text: {B}, Discard a creature card: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text:
"There are terrors lurking in the unseen corners of us all."
—Crovax

rulings.text: You can’t return the same card you are discarding. This is because you pick the target before paying the costs.

name: Venerable Monk
oracle_text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
flavor_text: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.

name: Verdant Touch
oracle_text: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target land becomes a 2/2 creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: The land is still a land and retains all its abilities, plus any other characteristics.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

name: Victual Sliver
oracle_text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: You gain 4 life."
flavor_text: "We are kinfolk," explained Karn to the sliver queen. "Just as you need your progeny to complete you, so do I need the pieces of the Legacy to make me whole."

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

name: Volrath's Gardens
oracle_text: {2}, Tap an untapped creature you control: You gain 2 life. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
flavor_text: "Watch yourself," warned Starke. "These plants aren't nice when they're hungry."

name: Volrath's Laboratory
oracle_text: As Volrath's Laboratory enters the battlefield, choose a color and a creature type.
{5}, {T}: Create a 2/2 creature token of the chosen color and type.

rulings.text: The token has the same name as the creature type.
The token does not have any built-in abilities. For example, choosing creature type Bird does not give the token Flying.

name: Volrath's Shapeshifter
oracle_text: As long as the top card of your graveyard is a creature card, Volrath's Shapeshifter has the full text of that card and has the text "{2}: Discard a card." (Volrath's Shapeshifter has that card's name, mana cost, color, types, abilities, power, and toughness.)
{2}: Discard a card.

rulings.text: If the top card in the graveyard has any other undefined characteristics, then those characteristics are not acquired and the shapeshifter uses the characteristic from its own card.

If the top card in your graveyard is a creature card, this card uses the listed characteristics, including color and any other types. But, this card keeps the granted ability in addition to those from the card being copied.
When it changes forms, any “enters the battlefield” abilities of the card it “copies” do not trigger.
A copy of a Volrath’s Shapeshifter will have the shapeshifting ability.

If the top card in your graveyard isn’t a creature card (meaning a card with the type Creature, which may or may not have other types such as Artifact or Enchantment), then it’s just a 0/1 blue creature. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.
The ability that sets its characteristics is a text-changing effect.

name: Volrath's Stronghold
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}.
{1}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
flavor_text: The seed of a world's evil.

name: Walking Dream
oracle_text: Walking Dream can't be blocked.
Walking Dream doesn't untap during your untap step if an opponent controls two or more creatures.
flavor_text: Dreams, by definition, live shorter lives than those who dream them.

name: Wall of Blossoms
oracle_text: Defender
When Wall of Blossoms enters the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor_text: Each flower identical, every leaf and petal disturbingly exact.

name: Wall of Essence
oracle_text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Essence is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.
flavor_text:
The ceiling and the floor fell in love, but only the wall knew.
—Dal saying

rulings.text: Wall of Essence’s triggered ability will trigger even if it’s dealt lethal damage. For example, if it’s dealt 7 combat damage, its ability will trigger and you’ll gain 7 life.

name: Wall of Razors
oracle_text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike
flavor_text:
"In this blessed structure let the very walls baptize themselves in the blood of intruders."
—Stronghold architect, journal

name: Wall of Souls
oracle_text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Souls is dealt combat damage, it deals that much damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
flavor_text:
"It is the nature of evil to turn you against yourself."
—Starke

rulings.text: Redirected damage is still combat damage, so it will trigger on combat damage that is redirected to it.

name: Wall of Tears
oracle_text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Tears blocks a creature, return that creature to its owner's hand at end of combat.
flavor_text:
"Many have been lost to pity."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Warrior Angel
oracle_text: Flying
Whenever Warrior Angel deals damage, you gain that much life.
flavor_text: She represents not hope, but hope's desperate fury.

name: Warrior en-Kor
oracle_text: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Warrior en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
flavor_text: Only a matter as vital as destroying Volrath could bring together the reclusive Kor people.

rulings.text: The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player.
It can redirect damage to itself.
It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature’s toughness.
You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt.
When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

name: Youthful Knight
oracle_text: First strike
flavor_text:
"Let no child be without a sword. We will all fight, for if we fail, we will certainly all die."
—Oracle en-Vec
